My role was to devise a corporate strategy and associated vendors and partners to allow Network Utilities to increase revenue and margins. Having devised the strategy, I hired and managed the team to deliver against it. 
 
Key Skills: 
 
•	Restructured company to generate revenues of £1.5m and with a profit margin of 25% 
 
•	Devised new service lead sales approach leading to services revenue increasing by more than 500%. 
 
•	Initiated and devised complex investment strategies with vendors generating a £250k marketing fund securing £700K in new business in return 
 
•	Negotiated and managed the outsourcing of a lead generation programme, generated more than 180 new introductions into medium & large enterprises in 12 months Managing Director Applictions Factory and Salesteam March 2003  –  January 2007  (3 years 11 months) A sales and marketing consultancy organisation that provided a complete service offering from strategic consultancy, interim and part time sales and sales management resources through to a completely outsourced sales organisation. 
 
As one of the directors, I was responsible for new business sales and the delivery of sales and marketing strategy programmes to their customers. 
 
My primary customer was Network Utilities. After acting as a Sales Director, and helping them restructure their go to market strategy and hiring a new sales team, the directors asked me to take on the role of MD and run the business. Sales Director Edenbrook 2001  –  2003  (2 years) Built and managed a team of 5 sales people, 4 direct and one channel, selling high value consultancy services based around ERP(Oracle), CRM(Siebel) and Microsoft .NET technologies into large blue chip organisations 
 
Edenbrook is a pure consultancy. When I joined, it had no dedicated sales team. I built the team ,and implemented a target account strategy selling into significant blue chip companies such as Reuters, GE Capital, Inchcape, Huhison 3G etc.. In my first year we grew the company's revenue figure from £2.2M to £5.8M maintaining profitability throughout, and winning 6 new accounts in the last 7 months. Each of these new accounts contributed in excess of. 
 
We achieved 110% of our revenue target for Q1 2003, and have significantly outperformed our margin target for the same quarter 
 
The revenue growth enabled Edenbrook to achieve the position of 67th fastest growing UK IT company as measured by The Times. Founder and CEO Big Blue Steel Tiger September 1999  –  November 2001  (2 years 3 months) I was the founder and C.E.O. of Big Blue Steel Tiger. Achievements include: 
•	Implemented sales and delivery strategy applicable in E-Commerce marketplace.
